random/gamma.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*
00002  * Gamma distribution
00003  *
00004  * Source: Ahrens, J.H. and Dieter, U., Generating Gamma variates
00005  * by a modified rejection technique.  Comm. ACM, 25,1 (Jan. 1982) 
00006  * pp. 47-54.
00007  *
00008  * This code has been adapted from RANDLIB.C 1.3, by
00009  * Barry W. Brown, James Lovato, Kathy Russell, and John Venier.
00010  * Code was originally by Ahrens and Dieter (see above).
00011  *
00012  * Adapter's notes:
00013  * NEEDS_WORK: more precision for literals.
00014  * NEEDS_WORK: ideally the normal_ member should be driven from
00015  * the same IRNG as the Gamma object, in the event that independentState
00016  * is used.  Not clear how this could be accomplished.
00017  */
00018 
00019 #ifndef BZ_RANDOM_GAMMA
00020 #define BZ_RANDOM_GAMMA

00022 #ifndef BZ_RANDOM_UNIFORM
00023  #include <random/uniform.h>
00024 #endif
00025 
00026 #ifndef BZ_RANDOM_NORMAL
00027  #include <random/normal.h>
00028 #endif

00030 #ifndef BZ_RANDOM_EXPONENTIAL
00031  #include <random/exponential.h>

00036 #endif

00038 BZ_NAMESPACE(ranlib)
00039 
00040 template<typename T = double, typename IRNG = defaultIRNG, 
00041     typename stateTag = defaultState>
00042 class Gamma : public UniformOpen<T,IRNG,stateTag>
00043 {
00044 public:
00045     typedef T T_numtype;
00046 
00047     Gamma()
00048     {
00049         setMean(1.0);
00050     }
00051 
00052   explicit Gamma(unsigned int i) : 
00053     UniformOpen<T,IRNG,stateTag>(i) 
00054   {
00055     setMean(1.0);
00056   };
00057   
00058     Gamma(T mean)
00059     {
00060         setMean(mean);
00061     }
00062 
00063   Gamma(T mean, unsigned int i) : 
00064     UniformOpen<T,IRNG,stateTag>(i) 
00065   {
00066     setMean(mean);
00067   };
00068 
00069     T random();
00070 
00071     void setMean(T mean)
00072     {
00073         BZPRECONDITION(mean >= 1.0);
00074         a = mean;
00075     }
00076 
00077 protected:
00078     T ranf() 
00079     { 
00080         return UniformOpen<T,IRNG,stateTag>::random(); 
00081     }
00082 
00083     T snorm()
00084     {
00085         return normal_.random();
00086     }
00087 
00088     T sexpo()
00089     {
00090         return exponential_.random();
00091     }
00092 
00093     T fsign(T num, T sign)
00094     {
00095         /* Transfers sign of argument sign to argument num */
00096 
00097         if ((sign>0.0L && num<0.0L)||(sign<0.0L && num>0.0L))
00098             return -num;
00099         else 
00100             return num;
00101     }
00102 
00103     NormalUnit<T,IRNG,sharedState> normal_;
00104     ExponentialUnit<T,IRNG,sharedState> exponential_;
00105 
00106     T a;
00107 };
00108 
00109 template<typename T, typename IRNG, typename stateTag>
00110 T Gamma<T,IRNG,stateTag>::random()
00111 {
00112     /*
00113      INPUT: A =PARAMETER (MEAN) OF THE STANDARD GAMMA DISTRIBUTION
00114      OUTPUT: SGAMMA = SAMPLE FROM THE GAMMA-(A)-DISTRIBUTION
00115      COEFFICIENTS Q(K) - FOR Q0 = SUM(Q(K)*A**(-K))
00116      COEFFICIENTS A(K) - FOR Q = Q0+(T*T/2)*SUM(A(K)*V**K)
00117      COEFFICIENTS E(K) - FOR EXP(Q)-1 = SUM(E(K)*Q**K)
00118      PREVIOUS A PRE-SET TO ZERO - AA IS A', AAA IS A"
00119      SQRT32 IS THE SQUAREROOT OF 32 = 5.656854249492380
00120      */
00121 
00122 static T q1 = 4.166669E-2;
00123 static T q2 = 2.083148E-2;
00124 static T q3 = 8.01191E-3;
00125 static T q4 = 1.44121E-3;
00126 static T q5 = -7.388E-5;
00127 static T q6 = 2.4511E-4;
00128 static T q7 = 2.424E-4;
00129 static T a1 = 0.3333333;
00130 static T a2 = -0.250003;
00131 static T a3 = 0.2000062;
00132 static T a4 = -0.1662921;
00133 static T a5 = 0.1423657;
00134 static T a6 = -0.1367177;
00135 static T a7 = 0.1233795;
00136 static T e1 = 1.0;
00137 static T e2 = 0.4999897;
00138 static T e3 = 0.166829;
00139 static T e4 = 4.07753E-2;
00140 static T e5 = 1.0293E-2;
00141 static T aa = 0.0;
00142 static T aaa = 0.0;
00143 static T sqrt32 = 5.656854249492380195206754896838792314280;
00144 
00145 /* JJV added b0 to fix rare and subtle bug */
00146 static T sgamma,s2,s,d,t,x,u,r,q0,b,b0,si,c,v,q,e,w,p;
00147 
00148     if(a == aa) goto S10;
00149     if(a < 1.0) goto S120;
00150 /*
00151      STEP  1:  RECALCULATIONS OF S2,S,D IF A HAS CHANGED
00152 */
00153     aa = a;
00154     s2 = a-0.5;
00155     s = sqrt(s2);
00156     d = sqrt32-12.0*s;
00157 S10:
00158 /*
00159      STEP  2:  T=STANDARD NORMAL DEVIATE,
00160                X=(S,1/2)-NORMAL DEVIATE.
00161                IMMEDIATE ACCEPTANCE (I)
00162 */
00163     t = snorm();
00164     x = s+0.5*t;
00165     sgamma = x*x;
00166     if(t >= 0.0) return sgamma;
00167 /*
00168      STEP  3:  U= 0,1 -UNIFORM SAMPLE. SQUEEZE ACCEPTANCE (S)
00169 */
00170     u = ranf();
00171     if(d*u <= t*t*t) return sgamma;
00172 /*
00173      STEP  4:  RECALCULATIONS OF Q0,B,SI,C IF NECESSARY
00174 */
00175     if(a == aaa) goto S40;
00176     aaa = a;
00177     r = 1.0/ a;
00178     q0 = ((((((q7*r+q6)*r+q5)*r+q4)*r+q3)*r+q2)*r+q1)*r;
00179 /*
00180                APPROXIMATION DEPENDING ON SIZE OF PARAMETER A
00181                THE CONSTANTS IN THE EXPRESSIONS FOR B, SI AND
00182                C WERE ESTABLISHED BY NUMERICAL EXPERIMENTS
00183 */
00184     if(a <= 3.686) goto S30;
00185     if(a <= 13.022) goto S20;
00186 /*
00187                CASE 3:  A .GT. 13.022
00188 */
00189     b = 1.77;
00190     si = 0.75;
00191     c = 0.1515/s;
00192     goto S40;
00193 S20:
00194 /*
00195                CASE 2:  3.686 .LT. A .LE. 13.022
00196 */
00197     b = 1.654+7.6E-3*s2;
00198     si = 1.68/s+0.275;
00199     c = 6.2E-2/s+2.4E-2;
00200     goto S40;
00201 S30:
00202 /*
00203                CASE 1:  A .LE. 3.686
00204 */
00205     b = 0.463+s+0.178*s2;
00206     si = 1.235;
00207     c = 0.195/s-7.9E-2+1.6E-1*s;
00208 S40:
00209 /*
00210      STEP  5:  NO QUOTIENT TEST IF X NOT POSITIVE
00211 */
00212     if(x <= 0.0) goto S70;
00213 /*
00214      STEP  6:  CALCULATION OF V AND QUOTIENT Q
00215 */
00216     v = t/(s+s);
00217     if(fabs(v) <= 0.25) goto S50;
00218     q = q0-s*t+0.25*t*t+(s2+s2)*log(1.0+v);
00219     goto S60;
00220 S50:
00221     q = q0+0.5*t*t*((((((a7*v+a6)*v+a5)*v+a4)*v+a3)*v+a2)*v+a1)*v;
00222 S60:
00223 /*
00224      STEP  7:  QUOTIENT ACCEPTANCE (Q)
00225 */
00226     if(log(1.0-u) <= q) return sgamma;
00227 S70:
00228 /*
00229      STEP  8:  E=STANDARD EXPONENTIAL DEVIATE
00230                U= 0,1 -UNIFORM DEVIATE
00231                T=(B,SI)-DOUBLE EXPONENTIAL (LAPLACE) SAMPLE
00232 */
00233     e = sexpo();
00234     u = ranf();
00235     u += (u-1.0);
00236     t = b+fsign(si*e,u);
00237 /*
00238      STEP  9:  REJECTION IF T .LT. TAU(1) = -.71874483771719
00239 */
00240     if(t < -0.7187449) goto S70;
00241 /*
00242      STEP 10:  CALCULATION OF V AND QUOTIENT Q
00243 */
00244     v = t/(s+s);
00245     if(fabs(v) <= 0.25) goto S80;
00246     q = q0-s*t+0.25*t*t+(s2+s2)*log(1.0+v);
00247     goto S90;
00248 S80:
00249     q = q0+0.5*t*t*((((((a7*v+a6)*v+a5)*v+a4)*v+a3)*v+a2)*v+a1)*v;
00250 S90:
00251 /*
00252      STEP 11:  HAT ACCEPTANCE (H) (IF Q NOT POSITIVE GO TO STEP 8)
00253 */
00254     if(q <= 0.0) goto S70;
00255     if(q <= 0.5) goto S100;
00256 /*
00257  * JJV modified the code through line 115 to handle large Q case
00258  */
00259     if(q < 15.0) goto S95;
00260 /*
00261  * JJV Here Q is large enough that Q = log(exp(Q) - 1.0) (for real Q)
00262  * JJV so reformulate test at 110 in terms of one EXP, if not too big
00263  * JJV 87.49823 is close to the largest real which can be
00264  * JJV exponentiated (87.49823 = log(1.0E38))
00265  */
00266     if((q+e-0.5*t*t) > 87.49823) goto S115;
00267     if(c*fabs(u) > exp(q+e-0.5*t*t)) goto S70;
00268     goto S115;
00269 S95:
00270     w = exp(q)-1.0;
00271     goto S110;
00272 S100:
00273     w = ((((e5*q+e4)*q+e3)*q+e2)*q+e1)*q;
00274 S110:
00275 /*
00276                IF T IS REJECTED, SAMPLE AGAIN AT STEP 8
00277 */
00278     if(c*fabs(u) > w*exp(e-0.5*t*t)) goto S70;
00279 S115:
00280     x = s+0.5*t;
00281     sgamma = x*x;
00282     return sgamma;
00283 S120:
00284 /*
00285      ALTERNATE METHOD FOR PARAMETERS A BELOW 1  (.3678794=EXP(-1.))
00286 
00287      JJV changed B to B0 (which was added to declarations for this)
00288      JJV in 120 to END to fix rare and subtle bug.
00289      JJV Line: 'aa = 0.0' was removed (unnecessary, wasteful).
00290      JJV Reasons: the state of AA only serves to tell the A >= 1.0
00291      JJV case if certain A-dependent constants need to be recalculated.
00292      JJV The A < 1.0 case (here) no longer changes any of these, and
00293      JJV the recalculation of B (which used to change with an
00294      JJV A < 1.0 call) is governed by the state of AAA anyway.
00295     aa = 0.0;
00296 */
00297     b0 = 1.0+0.3678794*a;
00298 S130:
00299     p = b0*ranf();
00300     if(p >= 1.0) goto S140;
00301     sgamma = exp(log(p)/ a);
00302     if(sexpo() < sgamma) goto S130;
00303     return sgamma;
00304 S140:
00305     sgamma = -log((b0-p)/ a);
00306     if(sexpo() < (1.0-a)*log(sgamma)) goto S130;
00307     return sgamma;
00308 
00309 }
